main event: A civilian reported a flying disc had landed on her roof in Seattle, Washington on July 6th, 1947. The object was described as a circular piece of plywood, newly painted light gray outside and red inside, with letters printed in white paint as "USSR" and "S.I.R.D" (eyes printed backward) and a hammer and sickle symbol mounted on it.
interesting points: The object was initially described as a flying disc, but it was later determined that it could not fly.
The object had radio tubes, wired up and mounted as a unit in a cylindrical-shaped oil can, with a short piece of rubber tubing and a piece of cloth believed to be saturated with turpentine.
Navy bomb and electronics experts and agents examined the object.
The report concluded that the object was a hoax, and it was determined that the disc could not fly
The object's peculiar design and the symbols printed on it generated significant attention and multiple press inquiries.
sighted object: circular plywood object with painted symbols
